description.narrative: In 2015, the coalition of the Norwegian Fair Finance Guide was formed by Framtiden i vare hender (Future in our hands) and Forbrukerradet (Norwegian Consumer council). Since November 2015, the Norwegian FFG is full member of the international FFG coalition. The 2organisations prepared the founding of FFG Norway on their own account; and are participating in the working groups of the FFGI since October 2015. We came to value their vision on financial sector development and the professionalism of their contributions This is the first contract with Framtiden. The organisation provided all necessary documentation regarding the organisation, its registration and financial administration. The Norwegian coalition succeeded in raising own funding for its functioning in 2016 from The Financial Market Fund. Therefore, they only need a relatively small amount of funding from the Sida project. The proposal presented by FFG Norway is clear and consistent and in line with the original proposal of the FFG for the first 7 countries. The main activities will be realized with separate funding (outside the Sida project, but very much in line with the Sida project): project coordination;baseline study of bank policies; website development; launch). The Sida project funding will be used for the national case study and travel costs to participate at the FFGI meetings in Stockholm and Jakarta, travel to exchange with FFG Sweden. With the connectionof Norway (and Denmark), the Scandinavian region will be very well represented within the FFGI coalition; because of the overlap ofbanks that operate in the region, they can support and strengthen each other’s efforts and become more effective.

participating-org.narrative: Framtiden i våre hender (The Future in our hands - FIOH) is Norway's largest environmental organization, and works for a fair distribution of the world's resources. The organization has about 25.400 members in 20 local groups in Norway, and 25 employees working at the head office in Oslo and with some of the local groups. Framtiden is a non-governmental organization, independent from political parties or religious groups; with a democratic structure, with a bi-annual general assembly and a board. Framtiden believes that the global environment and a globally fair distribution of wealth are inseparably linked, in a way that requires to work on both subjects in an integrated way. Framtiden works with research, information and political changes. They workto influence the companies policies, governmental decisions in an ethical and sustainable way, and to make government and business facilitate green and ethical choices. They do campaigns and awareness-rasing through social media, tv, radio and newspapers,advocacy and debates in schools, political assemblies and contact with political authorities. They focus on different subjects: - Consumption and consumerpower Create support for the need for a reduced consumption of goods and natural resources, to protect the environment and the climate. Contribute tocreate and organize the need in the population for a less commercialized society, and a lifestyle with a reduced focus on consumption. - Fair distribution Create support for global redistribution. Supply chain work and a living wage: Working for people in poor countries get decent working conditions and properly paid. Norwegian politicians and companies must ensure ethics in the supply chain and procurement practices. Work to reverse the flow of capital, which currently runs from the South to the North. - Sustainable and ethical business Monitoring ethical standards on Norwegian foreign investments and Norwegian businesses' conduct in developing countries. Special focus on human rights impacts end environmental standards. Ethics and sustainability must be integrated part of all fund management and financial institutions.
